newsitem.title: ANGOLA: Mideast and African port conditions - Lloyds.
newsitem.headline: Mideast and African port conditions - Lloyds.

text.p: Port conditions from Lloyds Shipping Intelligence Service --

ANGOLA, March 7 - Luanda - No vessels awaiting berths. Delays occurring due to continued quay congestion caused by uncleared cargo. Lobito - No berthing delays but congestion and occasional delays to vessels. Cabinda - Town and Molongo areas reported quiet. All crude terminals working normally, no delays reported.

ISRAEL, March 11 - No labour problems. Haifa - 10 Vessels operating of which 5 discharging at berth (3 general cargo, 2 bulkers), 1 container vessel, 4 tankers. 3 Vessels waiting at anchorage of which 1 containers, 2 tankers, 3 under repair/dry-docked, 4 awaiting orders, 3 due, with 2 days delay expected. Ashdod - 17 Vessels operating of which 11 discharging at berth (9 general cargo, 2 bulkers). 1 Bulker loading at berth, 3 containers, 1 car carrier, 1 passenger vessel. 16 Vessels waiting at anchorage of which 11 to discharge (9 general cargo, 2 bulkers). 1 Bulker to load, 4 container vessels, 1 awaiting orders, 2-4 days delay expected for new arrivals. Eilat - Three vessels operating of which 1 bulker loading at berth, 2 passenger vessels, 2 bulkers waiting at anchorage to load.

MOZAMBIQUE, March 10 - Nacala - Port working normally. No restrictions on berthing and sailing during night time. Draft restrictions 9.5 metres at general cargo berth and 14 metres at container berth. One tug available. Beira - General cargo berths working normally. Container terminal/other terminals - Working normally, 24 hour berthing/sailing for vessels up to 140 metres loa. Some restrictions for larger vessels and subject to prior arrangements with port captain. Maximum draft for 24 hour navigation 7.5 metres. Two tugs available.

General access channel two wave-rider buoys deployed in approach channel as follows wmon1 19 deg. 66.0460 s 36 deg. 01.6698 e and wmon2 19 deg. 62.6370 s 34 deg. 62.6497 e. Each buoy has an approximate diameter of 1 metre, with flashing orange light with a flash frequency of five one-second flashes every 36 seconds. Maputo - 24 Hour berthing/sailing for vessels up to 120 metres loa. Some restrictions for larger vessels and subject to prior arrangements with port captain. All berths working normally and expected to remain so. Draft restriction in the channel 9.0 metres less 0.5 metres plus the rise of tide. Maximum draft for 24 hour navigation is 9 metres.
NAMIBIA, March 10 - Walvis Bay - Port working normally.

YEMEN, March 10 - Hodeidah - Berths 1, 2, 6 and 7 occupied, all others vacant. 4 Vessels berthed of which 1 bulk wheat, 1 sugar, 1 general cargo, 1 containers, 2 bulk wheat, 1 wheat flour vessel waiting at anchor. Berthing delays, general cargo/containers up to 1 day, bagged cargo up to 3 days, bulk cargo up to 6 days. Mokha - No vessels berthed, 1 wheat flour vessel waiting at anchorage, no berthing delays.
